text:
Class of 2015, friends
and family, and members

of the Harvard business
school and community.
Good afternoon, and welcome.

I'm going to talk
to you about 3 Ps.

Purpose, perseverance,
and perspective.

In my experience, it's easier
to sustain energy and enthusiasm

in your work if you're
animated by a powerful belief

in the good you are doing
and by the knowledge

that your work has
a greater purpose.

We will now present the diplomas
for the Master in Business

Administration degrees starting,
unsurprisingly, with section A.

I believe there's a desperate
need for good leadership

in the world, that business can
be a powerful force for good
in society.

And that force can be
leveraged and magnified

if organizations are led by
well-trained and thoughtful
leaders.

Continue to remember the
importance of perseverance,

because success and progress
will not always come so easily.

They may sometimes require
long and patient work

to overcome both
legitimate hurdles
and systemic injustices.

But people who make a sharp
turn whenever they face failure,

often spend their lives
turning left and right

and risk never really
reaching anywhere.

You always learn something
by standing in another place
and getting another view.

Perspective sometimes also
requires putting yourself
in another person's position.
To see the world how they might.

And to have the
empathy that is so

vital for productive
relationships.

As you begin this journey,
I wish you Godspeed.
